message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

The paper proposes a novel model for community question answering that uses deep learning techniques such as recurrent neural networks and attention mechanisms. These techniques are commonly used in natural language processing and machine learning, which suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

Firstly, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a likely category as it covers topics related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. Secondly, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible category as the paper proposes a deep learning model for solving a complex problem. Thirdly, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible category as the paper uses deep learning techniques to train the model. Fourthly, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible category as the paper deals with the task of answer sentence selection and best answer selection. Finally, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possible category as the paper uses neural networks to solve the problem.
